storyTitle: As User, I want to receive notifications for scheduling conflicts to achieve timely adjustments

testCases.title: Validate notification delivery for detected conflicts
preconditions: User account is active and logged into the system
User has valid notification preferences configured (email, SMS, or in-app)
User has at least one existing scheduled event in the calendar
Notification service is running and operational
User has granted necessary permissions for receiving notifications

steps.action: Create a new event that overlaps with an existing event in the user's calendar to trigger a scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict and generates a notification within 2 seconds

steps.action: Navigate to user profile settings and check the configured notification preferences
steps.expectedResult: User's preferred notification channel (email, SMS, or in-app) is displayed and active

steps.action: Verify that the notification is sent via the user's preferred channel by checking the respective inbox/notification center
steps.expectedResult: Notification is successfully delivered through the preferred channel within 2 seconds of conflict detection

steps.action: Open the received notification and review its content
steps.expectedResult: Notification contains all relevant conflict details including: conflicting event names, date and time of both events, duration of overlap, and a direct link to resolve the conflict

steps.action: Verify the notification delivery status in the system logs or admin panel
steps.expectedResult: Notification delivery status shows as 'Delivered' with timestamp matching the conflict detection time

postconditions: Notification is marked as delivered in the system
User has received the conflict notification via their preferred channel
Notification delivery is logged in the system with timestamp
Conflict remains unresolved until user takes action

testCases.title: Ensure notifications are not sent for non-conflicting events
preconditions: User account is active and logged into the system
User's calendar is accessible and functional
Notification service is running and operational
No existing scheduling conflicts are present in the user's calendar

steps.action: Schedule the first event in the user's calendar with a specific date, start time, and end time (e.g., Meeting A from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM)
steps.expectedResult: First event is successfully created and saved in the calendar without any conflicts detected

steps.action: Schedule a second event in the user's calendar that does not overlap with the first event (e.g., Meeting B from 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM on the same day)
steps.expectedResult: Second event is successfully created and saved in the calendar. System confirms no scheduling conflict exists between the two events

steps.action: Access the notification logs via admin panel or API endpoint to check for any conflict notifications generated
steps.expectedResult: Notification logs show no conflict notifications were generated or sent for these two events

steps.action: Check the user's notification center, email inbox, and SMS messages (based on configured preferences)
steps.expectedResult: User has not received any conflict notifications. No new notifications appear in any of the notification channels

steps.action: Verify the system's conflict detection logic by reviewing event timestamps and overlap calculations
steps.expectedResult: System correctly identifies that the events do not overlap and no conflict detection is triggered

postconditions: Both non-conflicting events remain scheduled in the calendar
No notifications are present in the notification logs
User's notification channels remain clear of conflict alerts
System maintains accurate conflict detection without false positives
